pyutil.batch_renamer module¶

Renames a directory of files based on a template

Largely argparse and doctest practice. From pydocs tutorials stdlib2. Reformatted. Still uses old style strings as a result.

Examples:

>>> os.listdir("/path/to/dir")
# ['img_1074.jpg', 'img_1076.jpg', 'img_1077.jpg']
>>>  batch_renamer.py /path/to/dir
#  img_1074.jpg --> Ashley_0.jpg
#  img_1076.jpg --> Ashley_1.jpg
#  img_1077.jpg --> Ashley_2.jpg

Todo

First things first ensure it works at all. Then we should add some doctests maybe.

pyutil.batch_renamer.fix_extension()[source]¶

Rename files and group them by functions provided in datetime.

pyutil.batch_renamer.main(d)[source]¶

Renames a dir of files.

Parameters:d – The directory to iterate over.
